head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: Wounded Teenager Is Charged

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Law Enforcement and Security

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: Wounded Teenager Is Charged

body.head.byline: By EMILY VASQUEZ; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Edwin Guaman is charged with attempted robbery stemming from incident in which Guaman and another man were beating man as he yelled he was being robbed; off-duty New York City Police Lt Jose Jacome tried to stop robbery; Guaman was wounded during struggle for Jacome's gun and remains hospitalized (S)

block.p: A 17-year-old who was shot on Sunday when he tried to grab an off-duty police officer's pistol during a struggle in Jackson Heights was charged yesterday with attempted third-degree robbery, the police said. The teenager, Edwin Guaman, remained at Elmhurst Hospital Center last evening, the police said. The officer, Lt. Jose Jacome, a 16-year veteran assigned to the 110th Precinct, came upon Mr. Guaman and another man early Sunday beating a third person who was yelling that he was being robbed, the police said. Lieutenant Jacome identified himself as a police officer and tried to stop the robbery, the police said. It remained unclear yesterday whether the shot was accidental and who fired it, the police said.
